10 Notaries (Amendment) Act, No. 6 of 1961
Trosiions! 48, In every case where security has been given
Provseas. on behalf of a notary by the personal undertaking of
. two or more sureties under section 12 of the principal
enactment prior to the amendment thereof by this Act,
the following provisions shall have effect :
(1) During the period commencing on the date on
which this Act comes into Operation and ending on
such date (hereinafter called * the appointed date )
as may be appointed by the Miniter ty Order
Published in the Gazette, the provisions of the prin-
cipal enactment shall continue to apply as though those
provisions had not been amended by this Act:
Provided, however, that if at any time it is neces-
sary for such notary to furnish other sufficient security
under the principal enactment, stch security shall be
furnished in accordance with the provisions of section
12 of the principal enactment as amended by this Act.
(2) On or before the appointed date, the notary may
execute a fresh bond in accordance with the provisions
of section 12 of the principal enactment as amended
by this Act, and every person theretofor bound as
surety on bebalf of such notary shall thereupon be
deemed to be discharged from any Hability as such
surety im respect of any act of such notary done
thereafter. ,
(8) Where a fresh bond is not executed on or before
the appointed date as provided in any of the preceding :
provisions of this section, every person theretofor
ound as surety shall, on the day next following the .
pppointed date, be deemed to be discharged from any .
ability as such surety in respect of any act of eu
notary done after the appointed date, and the notary
shall execute a fresh bond, in accordance with the pro-
visions of section 12 of the principal enactment as
amended by this Act.
